title: Understanding Ion Implantation Defect Distributions in Silicon Induced by FIB and Other Ion Sources Using Advanced STEM
content: Focused ion beam (FIB) using Ga ions has been widely adopted for SEM and TEM sample preparation and for the modification of semiconductor devices on advanced technology modes or circuit edit. Alternative ion species such as He, Ne and Xe, have been recently explored in effort to eliminate or reduce the complication inherent to using Ga ions for those applications [1-3]. While there are studies on ion implantation and defects caused by various ion penetration in silicon substrate, the range (or extension) of the damage distribution due to different ion sources is not fully understood. This information is critical to determine the relative distance to the active device at which the ion beam can be applied during circuit edit to minimally impact device performance.
